katrenko.ws
Class applyCRF

java.lang.Object
  katrenko.ws.applyCRF

public class applyCRF
extends java.lang.Object

applyCRF uses functionality provided by MALLET and ABNER (@B. Settles, University of Wisconsin-Madison) to detect named entities in text provided an existing model and an output format.

          Creates a new instance of applyCRF

Method Detail

apply

public java.lang.String apply(java.lang.String testFile,
                              java.lang.String modelFile,
                              java.lang.String outputMode,
                              java.lang.String tokenization)
Applies an existing CRF model to a provided test set Input: test data (text), e.g.:

In contrast to the genes of the MAGE-A, MAGE-B and MAGE-C clusters, MAGED2 is expressed ubiquitously.

Returns annotated data in several formats (SGML, Abner, a list of entities)

Parameters:
testFile - test set (text)
modelFile - an absolute path to a folder where a model will be stored (including its name, e.g. "/home/Models/mymodel.mod"
outputMode - output format, can be one of the following: 1 IOB format

2 SGML

3 a list of entities

4 ABNER format

tokenization - 1 on

0 off

Returns:
the results in format provided by outputMode
